p.s: The given extract of Act 2 scene 2 of Shakespeare's work Romeo and Juliet, first published in 1579, is about the second meeting of the two lovers in the Capulet's orchard, when Romeo overhears Juliet talking about him and then comes out of hiding to respond.
Juliet is rather concerned regarding this meeting with Romeo.
She questions how he managed to climb the high walls to her family's orchard and warns him of the consquences that will follow if he is found.
Romeo replies to this that love has helped him overcome the walls and that he is not scared of being found.

However, Juliet still attempts to reason with him by saying that they might even kill him if he is found, to which Romeo only says taht he fears her contempt more than anything the Capulets might do to him and that her kindness would arm him against her family.
Since Juliet is not convinced, Romeo tells her that the darkness outside can hide him well enough but that he wold rather die than live without her love anyway.
When Juliet seems to calm down at taht she voices further concerns regarding the meeting.
She fears that Romeo's promise of love might prove to be false or taht he thinks that she is easily charmed.
Therefore she asks him to not swear his love lightly and offers to make it harder for him to win her over.
Her wish is that he does not take her love lightly because of how fast she fell for him.

Romeo wants to swear by the moon but Juliet finds it too changeablechangable and unpredictable, so when Romeo asks her what to swear on instead, she tells him not to swear at all or on himself instead, because he is godlike to her.
